intro: Jasione stricta, commonly known as narrowleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and linear. Jasione stricta is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, low-growing perennial.
